meanings.definition: The policy or practice of a wealthy or powerful nation extending its influence over less developed nations, often through economic or political means.
meanings.sent1: Neocolonialisms can lead to unequal relationships between countries.
meanings.sent2: Many countries struggle to break free from neocolonialisms imposed by others.
meanings.sent3: The concept of neocolonialisms can be seen as a modern form of control.
meanings.sent4: The grip of neocolonialisms tightens its hold on vulnerable nations.
meanings.sent5: The shadow of neocolonialisms looms large over global politics.

meanings.definition: The continued economic, political, or cultural dominance of a former colonial power over a former colony.
meanings.sent1: Neocolonialisms can hinder the progress of once-colonized nations.
meanings.sent2: The effects of neocolonialisms are deeply ingrained in many societies.
meanings.sent3: Some view neocolonialisms as a lingering ghost of the past.
meanings.sent4: Breaking free from neocolonialisms is a challenging journey for many nations.
meanings.sent5: The scars of neocolonialisms are still visible in the fabric of society.
